\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the City Planning Commission filed with the Council on October 2, 2017 its decision dated October 2, 2017 (the "Decision") on the application submitted pursuant to Section 197-c of the New York City Charter by the New York City Department of Housing Preservation and Development, for the acquisition of property located on a block generally bounded by East 111\super th\nosupersub  Street, Park Avenue, East 112\super th\nosupersub  Street and Madison Avenue (Block 1617, Lots 22, 35, 121, 122 and parts of Lots 23, 25, 28, 37), for use as passive recreation space and community gardens.  This action, along with the related actions would facilitate the development of three predominately residential mixed use buildings containing approximately 655 affordable dwelling units, commercial and community facility floor area, community gardens, and publicly accessible open space in the Manhattan Community District 11, (the \ldblquote Site\rdblquote ), (ULURP No. C 170364 PQM), Community District 11, Borough of Manhattan (the \ldblquote Application\rdblquote );\par
\par

\par
\tab WHEREAS, the Council has considered the land use implications and other policy issues relating to the Decision and Application; \par
\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj WHEREAS, the Council has considered the relevant environmental issues, including the Final Environmental Impact Statement (FEIS) for which a Notice of Completion was issued on September 19, 2017 (CEQR No. 17DCP048M), and the Technical Memoranda dated September 29, 2017, (the \ldblquote Technical Memoranda\rdblquote );\par

\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx864\tx2016\tx3168\tx4320\tx5472\tx6624\tx7776\tx8928\tab Having considered the FEIS and the Technical Memoranda with respect to the Decision and Application, the Council finds that:\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj  \tab\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi720\qj (1)\tab The FEIS meets the requirements of 6 N.Y.C.R.R. Part 617; \par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj (2)\tab\cf1 Consistent with social, economic and other essential considerations from among the   reasonable alternatives available, the action is one which avoids or minimizes adverse environmental impacts to the maximum extent practicable; and\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\cf0\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\fi-720\li1440\qj (3)\tab\cf1 The adverse environmental impacts identified in the Sendero Verde Development Alternative of the FEIS will be minimized or avoided to the maximum extent practicable by incorporating as conditions to the approval, pursuant to the Land Disposition Agreement(s) with the City, those project components related to the environment and mitigation measures determined to be practicable.\par
\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx0\tx720\tx1080\cf0\par

\pard\ltrpar\nowidctlpar\qj\tx720\tab\par
